meanings.definition: Unsteady or shaky in structure or movement
meanings.sent1: The old bridge was ricketier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The table became ricketier with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The ricketier chair wobbled comically as the cat tried to balance on it.
meanings.sent4: His confidence grew ricketier as the presentation went on.
meanings.sent5: The ricketier ladder creaked ominously as he climbed higher.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of weakness or deterioration
meanings.sent1: Her ricketier voice revealed her exhaustion.
meanings.sent2: The rusted metal gate looked even ricketier in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The ricketier fence sagged sadly under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent4: His ricketier resolve finally gave way under the pressure.
meanings.sent5: The ricketier floorboards groaned with each step, signaling their age.

meanings.sent1: The tower grew ricketier as the storm approached.
meanings.sent2: The ricketier glass threatened to break with the slightest touch.
meanings.sent3: The ricketier ice cream cone dripped faster than he could eat it.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship became ricketier with each argument.
meanings.sent5: The ricketier boat rocked dangerously in the rough waters.
